meanings.definition: Place or put after something else in time or order.
meanings.sent1: She always postposes her homework until the last minute.
meanings.sent2: After finishing his breakfast, he postposes brushing his teeth.
meanings.sent3: The cat postposes jumping off the couch until someone is watching.
meanings.sent4: The sun postposes its appearance until the clouds have cleared.
meanings.sent5: The teacher postposes giving the test until everyone is ready.

meanings.sent1: They decided to postposes the meeting until next week.
meanings.sent2: The rain postposes our picnic plans for the day.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy student postposes waking up early for class.
meanings.sent4: The chef postposes adding the final touch to the dish.
meanings.sent5: The bus driver postposes the departure time due to traffic.

meanings.definition: To place or set in a lower position.
meanings.sent1: He postposes the book on the bottom shelf of the bookcase.
meanings.sent2: The artist postposes the smaller painting beneath the larger one.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel postposes the acorn in a hidden spot for later.
meanings.sent4: The gardener postposes the seedling in the soil gently.
meanings.sent5: She postposes the vase on the lower shelf to make room for the new plant.
